markdownRemark.html:
I made the decision to stop using Git Hub pages for my blog (what little of it there is) after listening to Scott Hanselmansay on multiple occassions that you should own your content. Now, technically speaking, I still owned the content but I decided that I should probably own the domain as well.

So, I came across Netlify and their hosting seems reasonable enough. No more traffic than I receive I can go with the free plan.

The administration of the site is straight forward and they provide certificates for SSL at no extra charge. Since I purchased my domain through Netlify the setup was quite simple. I am also allowed to use sub-domains.

frontmatter.title: Switching to Netlify
frontmatter.description: Why switch from Heroku to Netlify.

frontmatter.title: What Command Do I Use To Start the Jekyll Server
